rules.title: Capitalize proper nouns
rules.description: Capitalize the names of specific people, places, organizations, and products. Do not capitalize generic terms or common nouns unless they are part of a proper name.

rules.title: Capitalize the first word of a sentence
rules.description: Always capitalize the first word in a sentence, regardless of the word or its type.

rules.title: Capitalize UI elements as they appear
rules.description: Capitalize buttons, menu items, dialog box titles, and other UI elements exactly as they appear in the product.

rules.title: Do not capitalize common nouns
rules.description: Do not capitalize generic terms unless they begin a sentence or are part of a proper noun.

examples.correct: Use a web browser to access the page.
examples.incorrect: Use a Web Browser to access the page.

rules.title: Capitalize acronyms and initialisms
rules.description: Capitalize all letters in acronyms and initialisms unless the style guide specifies otherwise.

rules.title: Capitalize headings and titles using sentence-style capitalization
rules.description: Capitalize only the first word of a heading or title and any proper nouns, unless your organization uses title case.
